attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
An idea has been put, suggesting that smokers should have to apply for permits in order to purchase cigarettes for their own personal use. This will cost smokers £10 a year and involve filling in a complex form.
This idea takes away peoples right to smoke if they wish and give control to government or who ever to decide if that person can have a permit to purchase their cigarette's.  
If smokers should have to have a permit to smoke, then people who drink alcohol should also. They cause more problems than any smoker due to being drunk and disorderly etc.Alcoholics also cost the NHS a lot of money every year due to Liver damage. It could then be said that you need a permit to do almost anything, should the powers that be decide that is the case.
Is this not a free country? It has started to feel otherwise.

rejection.details: There is a similar petition at : http://petitions.pm.gov.uk/smokingpermit/
reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
